abstract: Creates a custom blend kernel from a program string.
overview:
## Return Value

A new blend kernel object, or nil if the specified source code does not contain a valid blend kernel routine.

## Discussion

This method is similar to the [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIKernel/init(source:)] method of the superclass [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIKernel], but creates only blend kernels. Use this method when you want to ensure that the type of kernel object returned (if any) is always [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIBlendKernel].

# init(source:)

**Initializer**

Creates a custom blend kernel from a program string.

## Declaration

```swift
convenience init?(source string: String)
```

## Parameters

- **string**: A program in the Core Image Kernel Language that contains a single routine marked using the `kernel` keyword.

## Return Value

A new blend kernel object, or nil if the specified source code does not contain a valid blend kernel routine.

## Discussion

This method is similar to the [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIKernel/init(source:)] method of the superclass [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIKernel], but creates only blend kernels. Use this method when you want to ensure that the type of kernel object returned (if any) is always [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIBlendKernel].
title: init(source:)
